docs.snippet: Mr. Lauricella, known as Mr. Everything for his all-around play, was runner-up in 1951 for the Heisman Trophy while leading Tennessee to a national title, then became a Louisiana state legislator....

docs.snippet: Among the biggest complaints about the N.C.A.A. is that it has aggressively monetized nearly every aspect of its championships while it forbids players to negotiate paid endorsement deals....
docs.lead_paragraph: Among the biggest complaints about the N.C.A.A. is that it has aggressively monetized nearly every aspect of its championships while it forbids players to negotiate paid endorsement deals.
docs.abstract: One of the mainstays of the NCAA tournament is the prominence of the logos of corporate sponsors alongside the NCAA’s; in total, some 19 major partners and corporate supporters are listed in the official fan guide of the Final Four; NCAA’s opponents are using it as fresh ammunition in fight for change in policies concerning student athletes.

headline.seo: Financial Rewards of N.C.A.A.’s Sponsorship Deals Aren’t Shared With Players
headline.main: Points for Product Placement: N.C.A.A. Cashes In, but Not the Players
headline.print_headline: Points for Product Placement: N.C.A.A. Cashes In, but Not the Players

byline.contributor: Karen Crouse and Viv Bernstein contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: The NCAA president called an effort to unionize players a "grossly inappropriate" way to solve problems in college sports while insisting the association has plans to change the school-athlete relationship....

docs.snippet: With a push for change from lawmakers, players and doctors, and from discussions with the same experts who brought the issue to the fore in the United States, the topic is gaining momentum....
docs.lead_paragraph: With a push for change from lawmakers, players and doctors, and from discussions with the same experts who brought the issue to the fore in the United States, the topic is gaining momentum.
docs.abstract: Debate over how to respond to growing research linking brain trauma to injuries sustained in sports has spread to Europe; medical experts are calling for change, with some leagues and athletes resisting in the name of tradition; dialogue in rugby and soccer is being shaped by American legal cases on issue.

headline.main: In Europe, Echoes of America as Concussions Spur Debate
headline.print_headline: The Concussion Debate Moves to Europe
